Dvaja rybári zo Severnej Kórey zabili 16 členov posádky, potom ušli do Južnej. Nedovolili im zostať, pretože sú kriminálnici
07 Nov 2019, 21:17 by Timea Krauszová

Mladým mužom neudelili azyl.

Dvaja dvadsiatnici ušli na lodi do Južnej Kórey. Keď však miestne úrady zistili, že zavraždili 16 ľudí, odovzdali ich späť Severu. Hoci zvyčajne Južná Kórea udelí azyl každému utečencovi, tentokrát urobili výnimku. Usúdili, že sú to nebezpeční kriminálnici, ktorí by ohrozovali bezpečnosť v krajine. Píše BBC.
Priznali sa k vražde kapitána
Podľa miestnych úradov sa dvaja mladí rybári priznali, že spolu s tretím mužom zabili kapitána. Údajne kvôli hrubému správaniu. Neskôr zabili aj členov posádky, ktorým sa smrť kapitána nepáčila. Zabíjali ich postupne, jedného po druhom, a mŕtve telá prehadzovali cez palubu.



Najskôr sa po vraždách vrátili do Severnej Kórey, keď ale ich komplica chytila polícia, ušli na tej istej lodi na juh. Tam sa k nim správali skôr ako ku kriminálnikom než ako k utečencom. Podľa BBC nemohli mať stopercentnú istotu o ich úmysloch. Preto sa rozhodli nevpustiť ich do krajiny, namiesto toho mužov odovzdali úradom zo Severnej Kórey.
Toto je prvá deportácia zo strany Južnej Kórey.

ĎALŠIE ČLÁNKY, KTORÉ BY ŤA MOHLI ZAUJÍMAŤ

Two North Korean fishermen killed 16 crew members, then fled to South. They did not allow them to stay because they are criminals
07 Nov 2019, 21:17 by Timea Krauszova

Young men were not granted asylum.

Two in their twenties escaped by boat to South Korea. However, when the local authorities found that they had murdered 16 people, they handed them back to the North. Although South Korea usually grants asylum to every refugee, this time they made an exception. They thought they were dangerous criminals who would jeopardize security in the country. He writes to the BBC.
They confessed to the murder of the Captain
According to local authorities, two young fishermen confessed that they killed a captain together with a third man. Allegedly because of gross behavior. Later they also killed crew members who did not like the captain's death. They killed them one by one, dropping dead bodies overboard.



At first they returned to North Korea after the murders, but when their accomplice was caught by the police, they went south on the same ship. There they treated them more as criminals than refugees. According to the BBC, they could not have 100% certainty about their intentions. So they decided not to let them into the country, but instead handed them over to the North Korean authorities.
This is South Korea's first deportation.
